channel.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
channel.description: i know its possible in non static but is there a way in static

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Sure, but I was just suggesting he read that (since his code indicated that he didn’t know an awful lot about constructors).

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Don’t use constructors like that. Why not do this? It will work fine in a static method.

DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(new URL("http://www.google.com").openStream());

Or you could define a static method to download things.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/constructors.html

Read that, it’s fundamental to understanding how to use OO in Java.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @aaa801 aaa801
item.description:
@aaa801 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:7, topic:64267”]class fukhax
{
public static void main(String args[])
{ fukhax fh = ne wfukhax();}

public fukhax(){ downloadfile(); }
}

L2JAVA[/quote]

thanks got it working

Read full topic

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

As I said… go read about static, go learn why/when it is used. For the record, initializing and referencing like l33th4x said, is the way to go.

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Could you post the code you’re having trouble with? I have a suspicion that you’re trying to write an entire program in main().

item.source: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @aaa801 aaa801
item.description:
@aaa801 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:64267”][quote author=aaa801 link=topic=93160.msg970397#msg970397 date=1173048605]

Um…yes? What isn’t working for you?

i get cant be refered from a static context

what code do you use for downloading in static
[/quote]

That just means one of the methods or fields you are using in that class is not declared static, however in most cases a more appropriate way to do it is what 1337h4x did in the post above.[/quote]
:S

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“aaa801, post:6, topic:64267”][quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=93160.msg970225#msg970225 date=1173046567]
Um…yes? What isn’t working for you?
[/quote]

i get cant be refered from a static context

what code do you use for downloading in static[/quote]

That just means one of the methods or fields you are using in that class is not declared static, however in most cases a more appropriate way to do it is what 1337h4x did in the post above.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there anyway to download a file in a static context
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

class fukhax
{
public static void main(String args[])
{ fukhax fh = ne wfukhax();}

public fukhax(){ downloadfile(); }
}

L2JAVA
